sen.j: 中村 太郎（なかむら たろう、嘉永5年（1852年） - 明治11年（1878年）5月14日）とは、初代内務卿・大久保利通の従者。
sen.e: Taro NAKAMURA (1852 - May 14, 1878) was a servant to Toshimitsu OKUBO; the First Secretary of Interior.
Taro NAKAMURA (1852 - May 14, 1878) was a servant of Toshimitsu OKUBO; the First Secretary of Interior.

sen.j: 大阪の生まれだが、親のない捨て子であったのを大久保に拾われて「中村太郎」の名を与えられたという。
sen.e: He was born in Osaka as an orphan but fostered by OKUBO and given the name Taro NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 以後は大久保によく仕え、二頭立ての馬車を引く際には御者を務めた。
sen.e: He served OKUBO assiduously and took a coachman's seat when traveling in a carriage and pair.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）5月14日、赤坂仮皇居へ向かう途中、島田一郎・長連豪ら不平士族6名に襲われ、大久保は殺され、自身も喉を突かれて殺害された。
sen.e: On May 14, 1878, OKUBO and NAKAMURA were assassinated by six fuhei shizoku (former samurai with gripes) Ichiro SHIMADA, Go CHOREN amongst others on the way to Akasaka temporary Imperial Palace; NAKAMURA receiving a fatal thrust to the throat.

On May 14, 1878, OKUBO and NAKAMURA were assassinated by six fuhei shizoku (former samurai with gripes) including Ichiro SHIMADA and Go CHOREN on the way to Akasaka temporary Imperial Palace, where NAKAMURA received a fatal thrust into the throat.

sen.j: 墓所は大久保の墓と同じく青山霊園にある。
sen.e: His place of burial is located in Aoyama Cemetery where OKUBO was also buried.
